title.narrative: CG Rep. Agricultural Development and Rural Roads Rehabilitation Proj.

description.narrative: The restructuring of funds for the Agricultural Development and Rural Roads Rehabilitation Project for the Republic of Congo will: (a) consolidate support to indigenous communities and ensure proper technical assistance in finalizing the implementation of investments made; (b) harmonize the wording of the project development objective in the financing agreement with that in the project appraisal document; (c) extend the project closing date; and (d) reallocate funds to reduce credit for the project’s first three components and expand credit for the fourth. The objective of the project is to assist the Republic of Congo to increase the ability of the rural poor to raise their income through the generation and promotion of improved agricultural technologies, the provision of market infrastructure, and the formulation and implementation of poverty-focused agricultural policies and expenditure programs. The project components include: (1) building technical capacity and expertise in the Ministry of Agriculture, Fisheries and Livestock; (2) rehabilitating rural infrastructure and roads and market infrastructure rehabilitation; (3) supporting productive activities investments and sustainable livelihoods in rural areas; and (4) conducting project coordination and management.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock and Fisheries

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Article 4.01 (a) and Section I.F of Schedule 2 | Description :Effectiveness condition: The Recipient shalldeposit into the Project Counterpart Funds Account an amount of 2,000,000,000 CFA Francs. | Due Date :18-Aug-2014
Finance Agreement :Article 4.01 (b) Section I.B of Schedule 2 | Description :Effectiveness condition: The Recipient has updated theProject Implementation Manual. | Due Date :18-Aug-2014
Finance Agreement :H302-Section # 1 (A2) | Description :The Government shall deposit into the Project Account an initial amountequivalent to $2,000,000. | Due Date :05-Dec-2007

Finance Agreement :Section # 1 (A2) | Description :The Government shall deposit into the Project Account by April 1st and byOctober 1 of each calendar year during the Project Implementation period an additional annual amount equivalent to $2,250,000. |Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Section I.F of Schedule 2 | Description :Dated covenant: The Recipient has deposited 2,000,000,000 FCFA Francsinto the Project Counterpart Funds Account. | Due Date :18-Aug-2014
Finance Agreement :Section III | Description :The Recipient shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date,appoint an external auditor | Due Date :18-Dec-2014

Finance Agreement :Section III | Description :The Recipient shall, not later than three (3) months after the effective date,appoint in accordance with the provision of the Legal Agreement, and thereafter maintain at all time during project implementation,a procurement specialist, a Monitoring and evaluation specialist and an accountant with qualifications, experience and terms ofreference acceptable to the Association. | Due Date :18-Dec-2014

title.narrative: At least 50% of upgraded rural roads are maintained at appropriate standards
Number of farmers associations/households benefitting from matching grants (% of which are femal and youth)
After PY2, the Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock has prepared and adopted result-based sub-sector programs to guide the preparation and execution of the sectoral annual budget.
Periodic progress reports and IFRs are produced and submitted timely
By EOP, at least 80% of the procurement of goods and services is handled by the Ministry's procurement unit in conformity with public procurement guidelines.
Number of microprojects financed by the project
Number of producers with access to built or rehabilitated market infrastructure
Increase rate of annual sectoral budget execution/use of the MAE and MPA
Percentage of beneficiairies adopting production and processing advice/technology package
50% of the annual budget of the Ministry's regional offices is transferred to regional offices
Percentage of farmers associations/groups receiving agricultural extension services from MAE and MPA
Increased in income of project beneficiaries participating in micro-projects by end of project

actual.value: To be assessed by project end

title.narrative: Increased productivity of key agricultural products (cassava, banana and maize)

actual.value: To be assessed at the end of the production campaign (April 2017). Cassava takes at least 18 months to be harvested.

title.narrative: At least 90% of built market infrastructure is properly used and maintained by beneficiaries
At least 60% of farmers are satisfied with the services received from the extension workers and the Ministry of Agricuture by the end of the project (EOP)

actual.value: To be assessed at project end
